title: Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument: Park Home
body: Experience the Prehistory of Colorado  Beneath a grassy mountain valley in central Colorado lies one of the richest and most diverse fossil deposits in the world. Petrified redwood stumps up to 14 feet wide and thousands of detailed fossils of insects and plants reveal the story of a very different, prehistoric Colorado.                Centennial Summer 2016 Events   See what activities are taking place at Florissant Fossil Beds for the Centennial        Ranger Guided Programs   Are you planning a trip to Florissant Fossil Bed? Check out our ranger guided programs this summer!              Wildflower Walks   Join Ranger Shawn for Wildflower Walks every Sunday morning at 9:00 AM        Seminar Series 2016   Join the Friends of the Florissant Fossil Beds for one of five exciting seminars during the summer of 2016        Night Sky Programs   Observe the wonders of the night sky throughout the year.              Frequently Asked Questions   Frequently Asked Questions        Follow a Fossil Video   Learn about how fossils are excavated, studied, and conserved.        Every Kid in a Park   Learn how all 4th graders and their families get into parks for free.
